channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR

item.title: Report X-2024010247
item.description:
Report X-2024010247

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010247 SequenceEvent: Package was found on the unload rollers by unload door. Package was on it's side. Orientation arrows were not followed. Package was inspected at rollers and a wet spot was found. Package was then taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Liquid seeped out of the cap on to the face of the box that it was set on. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately taken to QA and separated from other packages. 2. X-2024010278 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS PLACED UPSIDE DOWN AT SOME POINT DURING TRANSIT. PACKAGE WAS TURNED UPRIGHT AND PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG AND DRUM. DescribePack: LEAKAGE FROM THE LID SEALS CAUSED BY PRESSURE FROM LIQUID DUE TO BOX BEING UPSIDE DOWN. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED UPRIGHT IN HAZMAT BAG AND DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023120506
item.description:
Report X-2023120506

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car found to be leaking from the bottom outlet cap at a rate of 2-3 gallons per minute. Upon arrival of the contractor, Code 3, the valve handle was in the closed, pinned, and sealed position and the bottom outlet cap was less than tool tight. Code 3 tightened the cap, stopping the release. After the car was set out, the contractor was able to climb under the car and determined that the valve was in the open position even with the handle closed. The handle was dropped to the open position, engaged, and the valve closed. The BOV plug was removed and verified the valve was closed with no release. The shipper was contacted and an OTMA was requested before the car would be released into transportation.
